column4: I'm trying to help someone get kubuntu edgy up and running. I'm on dapper. Can they install synaptic?
they already have Adept which is KDE's synaptic
but yes they can, but it's very very sucky because they must install GNOME libs
I see. What's wrong with GNOME libs?
/me hates GNOME -- AND it uses 110M disk space!
I'll just tell them to use Adept.
